1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles H Mundt Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary.

No contact with victim or family.

No contact with anyone under the age of 18, unless approved by agent.

May not possess any internet device, computer or video game system without prior agent approval.

GPS monitoring during Extended Supervision.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

10:12 a.m. Defendant Charles H Mundt in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Charles H Mundt in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kryshak argues for his motion for dismissing the verdict by the jury.  Atty. Kryshak states the defendant had GPS monitoring at the time of the assault.  Attorney Zell argues against the motion. The Court will not find at this time for dismissal of the verdict.  Court will allow the defense time to look into monitoring and will adjourn the sentencing hearing.  Atty. 9:44 Defendant Charles H Mundt in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.   Michael Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Christine Giacomino is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Zell. She is a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. Testifies as to interviewing techniques. Testifies as to her findings of interview with victim. 
10:06 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. Exhibit #2 is marked and reviewed with witness. 
10:16 Attorney Zell redirects. 
10:22 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. 
10:25 Attorney Zell redirects.
10:28 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness.
10:29 State rests. Court advises jury that parties agree that 3 of defendant's criminal complaints regarding other acts evidence presented at trial will be marked as exhibits 3-5. All exhibits are received.
10:31 Jury in recess. Court questions defendant his right to testify. He states he does not wish to testify.
10:37 Court in recess. 
11:22 Court reconvenes. Jury instructions are discussed. Direction 482 is discussed and Court will allow. 
11:35 Jury is brought into courtroom. Defense rests. 
11:36 Juror #2518 is selected as alternate and is dismissed.
11:37 Court gives closing jury instructions.
11:57 Attorney Zell gives closing statement.
12:17 Attorney Kryshak gives closing statement. 
12:33 Attorney Zell gives closing rebuttal statement.
12:39 Court gives closing jury instructions.
12:44 Bailiffs Tom Sachs and Gary Popelka are sworn as court officers and jurors retire to deliberate. Exhibits are discussed. Exhibits 2-5 will be given to the jury.
12:46 Court in recess.
2:11 Court reconvenes. Jurors return with verdict of guilty. Court polls jury as a whole. Jurors are dismissed.
Court enters conviction. Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation. Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

9:09 a.m.  Defendant Charles H Mundt in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On  the record without the jury present.   Parties place stipulations on the record.  The defendant is in agreement to the convictions placed on the record.  
9:14 a.m.  Jury brought in and Court is open.  23 jurors are called to the box.  Judge addresses the jury.
9:24 a.m.  Atty. Zell introduces himself and witnesses to the jury.  
9:25 a.m.  Atty. Kryshak introduces himself and defendant to the jury.
9:26 a.m.  Court commences with Voir Dire
9:32 a.m.  Atty. Zell commences with Voir Dire.  
9:47 a.m.  Atty. Kryshak commences with Voir Dire
9:50 a.m.  Counsel commence strikes and Court instructs jury.
10:01 a.m.  13 jurors are sworn in and seated.
10:04 a.m. Atty. Zell commences with opening statements
10:10 a.m.  Atty. Kryshak gives opening statements.
10:25 a.m.   Court recesses for 20 minutes
10:43 a.m.  Court reconvenes without the jury present.  Court addresses whether the victim would remain in the courtroom.  Atty. Zell argues for him to stay if he chooses.  Atty. Kryshak states he has no objection.s  Court allows the victim to be present in court if he wishes.  Jury enters. 
10:46 a.m.  State calls S. E. to the stand.  Witness is sworn and testifies to the facts.   Testifies to the events of 2012 in questions.  Testifies to how he knew the defendant.  Testifies to the day in question.  11:09 a.m. cross-examination by Atty. Kryshak.  Testifies to when he 1st talked to officers about the incident.  Testifies to what he said to Officer Fox.  Testifies to why he reported the incident a year later.  11:23 a.m. Atty. Zell redirects.  11:25 a.m  recross from Atty. Kryshak, 11:27 a.m. redirect from Atty. Zell.  11:29 re-cross from Atty. Kryshak.  
11:31 a.m.  Kyle Eisner is sworn as witness and testifies to the facts.  Testifies to how he knew the defendant.  Testifies to speaking with the victim about the incident.  11:40 cross examination by Atty. Kryshak.  11:41 a.m.  Officer Samuel Fox is sworn and testifies to working for the Marshfield Police Department.  Testifies to a report on Aug. 28, 2013.  Testifies what was said to why it was reported a year later.  11:48 a.m.  cross examination by Atty. Kryshak.   11:52, redirect from Atty. Zell.  Testifies that he referred this report to his detective bureau.  
11:55 a.m.Court adjourns for lunch.
1:12 p.m. Court returns.  State calls Christine Eisner to the stand and is sworn as witness.  Testifies to the facts.  Testifies to how she knows the defendant.  Testifies to when she 1st heard about the incident with the defendant.  Testifies to the incident between her and the defendant.  1:26 p.m.  Cross-examination by Atty. Kryshak.  redirect from Atty. Zell  1:34 p.m.  Harold Eisner is sworn as witness and testifies to the facts.  Testifies to how he know the defendant.  Testifies to when he noticed the change in the victim.  Testifies when he confronted the defendant. 1:43 p.m cross examination by Atty. Kryshak.  re-direct from Atty. Zell  1:51 p.m.  Samantha Lehn is sworn as witness and testifies how she knows the defendant.  Cross examination by Atty. Kryshak.  1:58 p.m. Shelly Fisher is sworn as witness and testifies to the facts.  Testifies to how she know the defendant.  Testifies to the incident in 1995.  Cross examination by Atty. Kryshak.  2:06 Frances Artac is sworn as witness and testifies to the facts.  Testifies to how she knows the defendant.  Cross examination by Atty. Kryshak.  Re-direct by Atty. Zell.  
2:13 p.m recesses till 2:30 p.m.  Court addresses information with the parties without the jury present.
2:37 p.m. Christine Giacomino is sworn as witness and testifies to her employment with the Marshfield Police Department.  Testifies to being a detective with the police department.  Testifies to the report she was given.  
2:39 Court recesses. Jury taken out.
3:10 p.m.  Court reconvenes Jury returns.  Court addresses the reason for the recesses.  Christine Ciacomino will conclude her testimony tomorrow.  Atty. Kryshak will show his tape from the child advancy.  Exhibit 1, (from the defense), tape.  Court reporter leaves.
3:13, tape begins playing.
4:19 p.m. Tape finished. jury excused.

Defendant Charles H Mundt in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Charles H Mundt in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Amended Complaint

3:07 Defendant Charles H Mundt in court with attorney David R. Dickmann.  Defendant Charles H Mundt in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has filed an amended criminal complaint. Attorney Dickmann indicates that he will be representing defendant today, but Attorney Kryshak will be representing him in the future.
Christine Giacomino is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. She is an Investigator with the Marshfield Police Department. On 9/10/13, she spoke to victim about a sexual assault that occurred in 2012. Victim reported to Officer Fox that he was with defendant at defendant's apartment in the City of Marshfield, Wood County, and was forced to watch a pornographic movie by defendant and was sexually assaulted by defendant. The door to the bedroom was locked by defendant when he attempted to run away. She also interviewed the victim and he described the sexual assault to her. Attorney Dickmann cross-examines witness. The incident occurred during the summer of 2012. Attorney Lambert redirects.
Harold Eisner is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is the father of the victim. He owns property in the City of Marshfield. He has known defendant most of his life and he has rented apartments to the defendant. The defendant was renting the apartment from him at the time this incident occurred. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. Attorney Dickmann cross-examines witness. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No contact with S.F.E. (DOB 6-7-00) or residence.
